title: Frightening moment an Australian tourist in Bali unleashes punches on bouncers outside a nightclub
text:
Disturbing footage has captured the moment a tourist, allegedly an NRL star, unleashed a barrage of punches outside a nightclub in Bali.

The viral footage shows a confrontation between a large man in a purple Hawaiian shirt and a group outside a venue on Jalan Laksamana Oboroi in Seminyak.

The man, believed to be a Melbourne Storm player, argues with the group before throwing a number of forceful punches among dozens of revellers.

Disturbing footage has captured the moment a tourist (pictured in the purple shirt) unleashed a barrage of punches on bouncers outside a night club in Bali

The fight spreads from the footpath outside the club on to the road between cars.

Bystanders were forced to scatter away from the brawl as the men raged across the street.

The Storm player's teammate was allegedly 'king hit' moments earlier, the Herald Sun reported, sparking the violent melee.

Melbourne Storm released a statement on Sunday night saying the club had reported an incident in Bali involving a player to the NRL’s Integrity Unit.

'Storm has launched a full investigation into what has occurred,' the statement read.

'Storm takes these type of incidents very seriously and will not be making any further public comment at this time.'

Daily Mail Australia has contacted local police for comment.
description: Disturbing footage has captured the moment an Australian tourist, allegedly an NRL star, unleashed a barrage of punches on bouncers outside a nightclub in Bali.
authors: Jackson Barron For Daily Mail Australia
